column2: ca215, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Went to PCP to ask for help with 10-years-ongoing pain both hips ranging from intolerable on "good" days to intractable pain on bad days.Doc claimed, after I told him I had approx two months of vomiting once or twice a week, that what I need is prilosec.Dr began dosage of PREVACID, 15mg @midday, gave me 14 capsules to use over 2 week period after which I'm supposed to go to appointment with him to tell him (quote) "How this works for your pain."Right. Pain. I do not have the heartburn for which dr said he was offering me the Prevacid.Apparently vomiting = heartburn, in drs' opinion.NO. I tried to explain I do not get heartburn, indigestion, any of his other euphemisms.That is I didn't get those things before starting the Prevacid.If this is supposed to be the precursor to Prilosec and another 14-day course of medicating, I'm not sure I can get through it. And: if I do make it through the total of 4 weeks of Prevacid, then Prilosec, doc wants me to accept Relafen.Please urge your doctor to LOOK at your file. Mine does not do that especially as regards vivid and rapidly-occurring adverse effects due to present health issues and other meds being used at the time of using the Prevacid then move to Prilosec to be followed by the Relafen.Dr doesn't like it if I check on things he wants me to do according to what I think must be his "Let's try THIS on her" school of medical treatment.Of course he doesn't bother to check on other meds being used or health issues that might interact badly and cause further problems than exist now.Effects, after only 3 days: upset stomach, slight nausea, flatulence, burping, belching bile into throat and mouth, headache...and, according to Dr Wonderful (yeah right) the anti-acid med should reduce pain begun 10 years ago after hip- breaking fall and shoddy repair surgery.Dr claims I will be able to reduce dosage of painmasker meds. I don't understand that at all and he would not explain it to me.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with LPR (reflux) after having throat spasms at night, causing me to wake, feeling like I couldn't breathe. After a scopy, the doctor realized I had LPR and most of the other symptoms. I started taking Prilosec and Zantac. It was generally tolerated in the beginning and was effective (as a second scopy revealed 8-9 weeks later). However, 7 weeks into treatment I started having an irregular heartbeat and major fatigue. Irregular heartbeat stopped the day I stopped taking it (I ran out so it happened this way). A doctor put me on AcipHex for now. I've also made all the lifestyle and behaviorial modifications one can make to help the issue: sleeping on a 6-inch wedge, eating healthy and non-acid producing foods, small meals, not eating within 2-3 hours before bedtime, etc.

column9: for many years I experienced a sudden inability to swallow while eating. I visited Doctors at the University of Southern California swallowing center who, after a number of tests considered surgery which I rejected after speaking with the surgeon, and as a last resort prescribed Prilosec. I have on ocasion stopped only to have the condition return. so far I have not experienced any side effects.

column2: steve, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: About 15 years ago I was diagnosed with a hiatel (sp?) hernia. I was put on Tagamet and Axid etc. and they did nothing for my acid reflux and heartburn. When prilosec came out, I was then given a prescription for it.  It was the most amazing thing I've ever taken for heartburn in my life. I am pain free, and can eat just about anything out there. I've tried the generic and it doesn't seem as effective. Since the OTC came out, I buy that, as my insurance quit paying for the Rx version. Also, prevacid seems to work the same way, but as there is no OTC for it, I stick with prilosec. Been taking it now for over 5 years, and I have not noticed a single side effect, or weakness, or anything that has been described. Hopefully, I can continue to take the medication without any problems for a very long time, and I hope something isn't building up inside because of it that I don't know about. But right now, it's better than vomiting acid and waking up coughing due to acid in my esophogaus. I don't miss that at all.

column2: pHlummoxed, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've been taking omeprazole for a decade or so for chronic gastritis.  Sometimes I forget for a day or two and without fail, I'll get heartburn/indigestion.  I've noticed that since taking omeprazole, I have become predisposed to bladder infections, yeast infections, and bacterial vaginosis.  I believe the pH of both systems is being affected and I'm really surprised that these are rare or unmentioned side affects.  Also just was diagnosed with chronic endometritis, which can occur as a result of untreated asymptomatic bacterial vaginosis.  I had no idea - I'm clean and (I thought) healthy.  Every once in a while I'd get a fishy odor (sorry!) but it would go away.  Now I find out this is not normal and needs antibiotics (and then diflucan).   Tell your doctor and report this to the FDA via medwatch if it affects you too!

column9: This is the umpty-ump drug I've tried for reflux and it's right up there with the other horrors (nexium, aciphex, kapidex,etx.). I'm constantly nauseated, twitchy, fluish and out of sorts. Is there nothing, short of surgery, that can make this condition behave?

column2: BeingSickSucks, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have LPR, which is inflammation in my throat due to stomach acid. I was prescribed 4 Prilosec per day, which I took for 2 weeks and had awful anxiety attacks, pins and needles feelings in my fingers, and heart palpitations. I dropped the dosage down to 2 pills a day, which eliminated most of those side effects, however, I have been losing weight at an alarming rate, and worst of all, the sensation of something being stuck in my throat has not gone away after taking Prilosec for a total of 6 weeks now! I pray there is some better medication than this.

column2: kittie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: only takeing this medication three,to four times a day gives me some comfort. Early am and midday,late evening are my worst times,when i get the knot in my chest and the pain is unbearable.

column1: Condition in which Stomach Acid is Pushed Into the Esophagus

column9: i have to take atleast one twice a day.  sometimes need two every a.m. get nauseous,severe gerd, and finally vomit due to extreme rising up of food and burning if miss one or 1/2 a day.  still some heartburn,raw esophagus..cannot lay down at night without it without vomitting.  have taken 4 a day.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Works great if taken every day, I still don't eat after 6:00 so there will be noproblems when I sleep. I am concerned that my hair is thinning. Hope it is not theprilosec.  I noted that prolong use effects the B12 in your body.

column1: Condition in which Stomach Acid is Pushed Into the Esophagus
column2: ryanpatrik, 45-54 Male  (Patient)
column9: I was switched to this from Prevacid because insurance demanded it. Seems to do the same excellent job but I have been gaining some weight. After reading other reviews I wonder if the drug slows metabolism in some way. Other research I found suggested taking the 20mg dose every other day and I am going to try that. If it still works at the very least I will save some money! I guess I will have to eat less and work out more to stop the weight gain, which has been 8-9 pounds in 3 months. I wonder if those of us who are experiencing weight gain are just eating a bit more because we feel better? I am going to try to figure that out over the next few months.

column2: bella, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took Prevacid for years and insurance no longer wanted to pay w/o trying Prilsec OTC.  I tried the generic brand and immediately developed severe constipation, bloating, weight gain, anxiety attack(thought I was dying and went to hospital), abdominal pain,  sluggish, now diagnosed with IBS because none of my doc's believe the Prilosec had anything to do with these symptoms even though that is when the trouble started.  Thousands of dollars later and a colonoscopy and endoscopy and numerous doctors visits and referals to specialists, I have now started back on the Prevacid and all symptoms disappeared within one month.  Recently had a mix up with my mail order pharmacy calling the doc and asking if it was ok to replace the Prevacid again with the Prilosec OTC and unfortunately for me he agreed without looking at my file and then I was without the Prevacid again until this was resolved.  During this two week period I took the generic Prilosec OTC that I had remaining from before and immediately all IBS symptoms returned.  Prevacid is very expensive and I could not afford it w/o insurance.  I hear it will be going to a generic in the future.  It won't be soon enough for me. Maybe then my insurance co will not have as big of a problem paying for it.  This drug absulutely caused me more misery and cost me and the insurance so much more than if they had of went ahead and paid for the Prevacid in the first place.  It may work for some and that's great, but it's definately not for me!

column1: Stomach Ulcer from Aspirin or Ibuprofen-Like Drugs
column2: RLG, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking NSAID's for the past 5 years for Lupus. Last fall, I started experiencing many stomach problems. The GI said it was from the NSAID's and told me to take Prevacid each day. I had to stop taking it because it counter-acted all my other medications. He put me on Prilosec. I am always nauseated (so much that I take Dramamine every day to function). I am very bloated and have diarrhea - which the Prilosec is supposed to be helping. I can't seem to mustard up any energy. The Prilosec is better than the Prevacid, however, I feel that the effectiveness of my other medications are lessened.

column2: kenshel622, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After continued use over a period of 3 months I discovered a higher anxiety level and mild mental depression. When getting off of the med I feel much better.  Still dealing with the gerd but pepcid seems to be handling it. Also, weight gain is really unbelievable. Gained over 15 pounds in this period. Also...higher blood pressure readings. Since being off the med the readings are normal.

column2: sassy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had stomach acid so bad that I would almost be in tears. It burned so bad that I would make myself throw up to get the acid out and that did the trick but it was awful. And I had acid reflux. Couldn't lie completely prone. Tried several of the more popular prescription drugs and nothing worked. Tried Prilosec OTC and it saved my life. Says it doesn't work immediately but it works very fast for me, 30 minutes or so. Don't know why. I've been taking it for about 6 years. My proctologist said if it is working, keep taking it, even tho it says take it for only 14 days. I have put on a lot of weight but did not associate it with Prilosec until I read some reviews here. Had severe leg cramps this summer and became very hydrated. I began taking potassium tabs. I sometimes become extremely lethargic - some here say that is a symptom. Is it? If I skip for a couple of days, the acid returns and it's unbearable. Am trying the generic this time. Seems to be working almost as well.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: HOW LONG ARE YOU SUPPOSED TO TAKE THIS ? I HAVE BEEN TAKING THIS FOR ALONG TIME. IF I CONTINUE, WILL IT STOP WORKING BECAUSE MY BODY IS AMUNED TO IT. I HAVE BEEN TAKING THIS FOR OVER 2 YEARS.

column2: Wolves13, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Have been taking Prilosec for about 4 months. It helped at first with the heartburn and I was so relieved that I had finally found something to help.  However, about 2 months into treatment I noticed constant bloating in my upper abdomen and a dull ache.  I was also gaining weight even though I had not changed my diet.  I have gained about 15 pounds in the 4 months.  I also have a persistant tickling in the throat that makes me cough a lot.  I have just found out that I have what is known as fatty liver.  I have never had problems with my liver! I also have lower back and shoulder pain.  It seems I have developed all of the symptoms that others seem to have.  I also have felt "panicky" at times and flush in the face.  I am stopping the medicine and will try something else.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i had to clear my throat often, my doctor recommended  to take Prilosec for three months. After taking for 5 days, I started to have serious trouble breathing. For every 10 secs I have to take a deep breath and it's almost 10days since I stopped taking this medicine but my breathing trouble doesn't go away. I went back to doctor, I asked me to do a check X-ray, EKG, Breath test. I am yet to do Stress test too. Its frustrating what this drug has done to me. It's inconvenient to take deep breath every 10 seconds. Hope this will go away. I am very scared now.Also after stopping to take this drug, I came to know what heart burn is. As before taking this medicine I never had any heart burn except have to clear my throat. I would suggest please observe for side effects very carefully when taking this medicine.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I went on the generic omaprezole and became very constipated.  Now the stomach pains are becoming intolerable and I have gained a lot of weight in spite of watching my diet.  I'm also having other pain which may or may not be from the drug.  I'm probably going to have to go back on Aciphex and cut my spending elsewhere.  Life is miserable enough with heartburn without suffering from the cure.

column2: Lyndi, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I took two tablets per day for several years.  Whenever I tried to stop, my heartburn was much worse than when I first started the treatment.  I also had a lot of bloating, but did not make the connection.  When I started noticing that my hair was thinning considerably, I went on line to find out the causes of hair loss.  Imagine my surprise to find that acid inhibitors can cause hair loss.  I have also been diagnosed with osteoporosis, also a side affect of these drugs.  I have stopped using the Prilosec OTC and am trying to eat several small 'meals' a day and trying to eliminate the foods and drinks that trigger heartburn.Not easy because they are all my favorites, especially hot chocolate.

column2: a guy who cares, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had heartburn for about 4 years. In the past 2, it has gotten so bad, I have drool poring out of my mouth like a water fountain and pain so bad I cant bare it. I can not eat anything i enjoy or drink a cup of coffee, and it was everyday. i took this medication and just like that, gone.  It was wonderful...for about a week.  Then side effects you wouldnt think of came in.  i had panic attacks that got worse and worse, and my body turned beat red like I was standing in the cold without a shirt on.  I dont know whats worse, GERD or panic attacks, they both suck.  But for my health, I will stop this medication, bc I would rather change what i eat and be more healthy then have panic attacks everyday and thinking Im dying.  i would recommend this, as long as you can deal with the side affects it gives you, everyone is different.  But don't get me wrong, it is the most affective prescription.

column2: BIG G, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: MartinLuvJags, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I ve been having ocassional heartburn for 12 years, hust a few weeks ago got really bad that had to go to DR, originally got ACIHEX which worked on second day but at refill time found out that its 185 $ for 30 pills (no insurance)Tried prilosec cause its cheaper n took 5 days to kick, it really helped, no more food stuck in esophagus sensation or really bad heartburn that even had to pull over while driving, but also exercising more n checking my diet, eating slow helped too, I lost 15 pounds already, had the lightheaded n stomach cramps side effect too in first week but i did not know about the anemia, i better check that n have an endoscopy, anybody knows if its safe to take 2 tabs a day?? thx

column2: MattSeattle, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Taking Prilosec OTC has been a total relief for me.  I would get "heartburn" so bad that I would have to stop walking to let things "settle back down", and would often prop myself up at night, using my bed pillows to create a "ramp" to keep everything where it was supposed to be!  The pain was so focused and intense, it would almost bring tears to my eyes.  I took unending hand fulls of Tums, Alka Seltzer, and anything else I hoped would work.  Nothing did!   Pirlosec OTC, taken once daily, for me, taking one pill daily has COMPLETELY eliminated any trace of heartburn. column2: Over50, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: tygerlilie7, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

I would wake up in the middle of the night gasping for breathe it had gotten so bad. I decided to try Prilosec and I haven't had heartburn since. It has been over 6 months. I have to take it every day but I have it approved by my doctor. Nothing works as well as Prilosec... And it's only one pill a day!

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Prilosec OTC is darned effective when taken as directed. It doesn't take effect immediately, so you really begin to feel better in the next 1-2 days.The drug is a bit expensive, but P&G puts out coupons on a pretty regular basis.  I think this is also covered if you have a Health Savings Account set up to may for out-of-pocket medical costs and co-pays.
